snippet: The trim — more than $1 billion from last year’s budget — is the first time since the financial crisis that Volkswagen has not increased investment.
abstract: Volkswagen, hurt by diesel emissions cheating scandal, says it needs to cut its budget in 2016 for new technology and research; layoffs, while still possible, will not be easy in Germany.

byline.original: By JACK EWING and JAD MOUAWAD
byline.contributor: Jack Ewing reported from Wolfsburg, Germany, and Jad Mouawad from New York.

lead_paragraph: The trim — more than $1 billion from last year’s budget — is the first time since the financial crisis that Volkswagen has not increased investment.

headline.main: VW Cuts Its R.&D. Budget in Face of Costly Emissions Scandal
headline.print_headline: Costs Rising in Scandal, VW Makes Budget Cuts
